00035 
00036 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00037 
00038 unsigned long cfs_fail_loc = 0;
00039 unsigned int cfs_fail_val = 0;
00040 int cfs_fail_err;
00041 DECLARE_WAIT_QUEUE_HEAD(cfs_race_waitq);
00042 int cfs_race_state;
00043 
00044 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_fail_loc);
00045 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_fail_val);
00046 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_fail_err);
00047 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_race_waitq);
00048 EXPORT_SYMBOL(cfs_race_state);
00049 
00050 int __cfs_fail_check_set(__u32 id, __u32 value, int set)
00051 {
00052         static atomic_t cfs_fail_count = ATOMIC_INIT(0);
00053 
00054         LASSERT(!(id & CFS_FAIL_ONCE));
00055 
00056         if ((cfs_fail_loc & (CFS_FAILED | CFS_FAIL_ONCE)) ==
00057             (CFS_FAILED | CFS_FAIL_ONCE)) {
00058                 atomic_set(&cfs_fail_count, 0); /* paranoia */
00059                 return 0;
00060         }
00061 
00062         /* Fail 1/cfs_fail_val times */
00063         if (cfs_fail_loc & CFS_FAIL_RAND) {
00064                 if (cfs_fail_val < 2 || cfs_rand() % cfs_fail_val > 0)
00065                         return 0;
00066         }
00067 
00068         /* Skip the first cfs_fail_val, then fail */
00069         if (cfs_fail_loc & CFS_FAIL_SKIP) {
00070                 if (atomic_inc_return(&cfs_fail_count) <= cfs_fail_val)
00071                         return 0;
00072         }
00073 
00074         /* check cfs_fail_val... */
00075         if (set == CFS_FAIL_LOC_VALUE) {
00076                 if (cfs_fail_val != -1 && cfs_fail_val != value)
00077                         return 0;
00078         }
00079 
00080         /* Fail cfs_fail_val times, overridden by FAIL_ONCE */
00081         if (cfs_fail_loc & CFS_FAIL_SOME &&
00082             (!(cfs_fail_loc & CFS_FAIL_ONCE) || cfs_fail_val <= 1)) {
00083                 int count = atomic_inc_return(&cfs_fail_count);
00084 
00085                 if (count >= cfs_fail_val) {
00086                         set_bit(CFS_FAIL_ONCE_BIT, &cfs_fail_loc);
00087                         atomic_set(&cfs_fail_count, 0);
00088                         /* we are lost race to increase  */
00089                         if (count > cfs_fail_val)
00090                                 return 0;
00091                 }
00092         }
00093 
00094         /* Take into account the current call for FAIL_ONCE for ORSET only,
00095          * as RESET is a new fail_loc, it does not change the current call */
00096         if ((set == CFS_FAIL_LOC_ORSET) && (value & CFS_FAIL_ONCE))
00097                 set_bit(CFS_FAIL_ONCE_BIT, &cfs_fail_loc);
00098         /* Lost race to set CFS_FAILED_BIT. */
00099         if (test_and_set_bit(CFS_FAILED_BIT, &cfs_fail_loc)) {
00100                 /* If CFS_FAIL_ONCE is valid, only one process can fail,
00101                  * otherwise multi-process can fail at the same time. */
00102                 if (cfs_fail_loc & CFS_FAIL_ONCE)
00103                         return 0;
00104         }
00105 
00106         switch (set) {
00107                 case CFS_FAIL_LOC_NOSET:
00108                 case CFS_FAIL_LOC_VALUE:
00109                         break;
00110                 case CFS_FAIL_LOC_ORSET:
00111                         cfs_fail_loc |= value & ~(CFS_FAILED | CFS_FAIL_ONCE);
00112                         break;
00113                 case CFS_FAIL_LOC_RESET:
00114                         cfs_fail_loc = value;
00115                         atomic_set(&cfs_fail_count, 0);
00116                         break;
00117                 default:
00118                         LASSERTF(0, "called with bad set %u\n", set);
00119                         break;
00120         }
00121 
00122         return 1;
00123 }
00124 EXPORT_SYMBOL(__cfs_fail_check_set);
00125 
00126 int __cfs_fail_timeout_set(__u32 id, __u32 value, int ms, int set)
00127 {
00128         int ret = 0;
00129 
00130         ret = __cfs_fail_check_set(id, value, set);
00131         if (ret && likely(ms > 0)) {
00132                 CERROR("cfs_fail_timeout id %x sleeping for %dms\n",
00133                        id, ms);
00134                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00135                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(ms) / 1000);
00136                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00137                 CERROR("cfs_fail_timeout id %x awake\n", id);
00138         }
00139         return ret;
00140 }
00141 EXPORT_SYMBOL(__cfs_fail_timeout_set);
